data.title: STF Vilhelmina Kyrkstaden
data.meta_description: Vilhelmina is beautifully located in the south of Lapland. The picturesque alleys of the church town are reminiscent of life many hundreds of years ago. A genuine environment surrounded by exciting culture and beautiful nature.
data.text:
The beautiful small community Vilhelmina is located by Lake Volgsjön in southern Lapland. Here culture, nature and exciting outdoor activities meet. With a large selection of culture, arts and crafts along with a wilderness around the corner, it is a place worth staying in a little longer.

Church towns are mainly a northern phenomenon. Church towns used to be a necessity here because the parishes could be huge on the surface. The church town in Vilhelmina is from the end of the 18th century. In the picturesque neighborhoods with their small alleys, there is also a local history museum, craft house ans a art gallery.

You stay in the charming old cottages, most of them with fireplaces and the so-called Vilhelmina wallpaper on the walls. Each cottage has its own special character, and is carefully renovated in older style.

Vilhelmina also offers a strong food and craft culture and fantastic nature experiences all around. Walk along Volgsjön and stop at Gubbseleforsen. Or take a walk and experience the Blaikfjället nature reserve. Here you will find easy-to-walk paths with nice stairs and beams. The fishing is world class with flowing water and lakes.

Please note that the reception is located at the Tourist Office, Tingsgatan 1 (Tingshuset). For check-in on weekends and after 5 pm, make sure to contact with the reception well in advance on telephone 0940-39887.

Enjoy your stay here. Welcome to the beautiful community Vilhelmina!
